entry.title: Re: Determining freight costs in the STO transfer process
entry.content:
It seems like requirement is to capture cost on material valuation for STO. This is a standard functionality. Add a cost condition in STO pricing schema. Cost will be distributed based on weight. Material valuation should be active. Refer below link for details:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/sto-freight-cost-loaded-on-material-cost/qaq-p/11837754

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/sto-pricing-procedure/qaq-p/7974940

In case you are using transportation module which does freight cost calculation and posting to ERP, then this requirement can be handle in Transportation module.

entry.title: Re: Wireshark with SAP Dissectors for Ubuntu and macOS
entry.content:
Seems this blog is nowadays "read-only" even for its author (me), maybe due to the change of blog-toolset in SAP Community site in early 2024, I don't know. Anyway, here is some additional information from when I was recently setting up the SAP Dissectors for Wireshark in MacBook case...

Port Numbers

If in the Preferences pane of Wireshark you are offered the chance to modify the port numbers each SAP Dissector applies for, then you would make the modifications according to your needs. For example, in Wireshark for MacBook, I changed the values for the SAP Dissectors as follows: 

SAPDIAG to 3200-3299 (instead of just 3200); SAPMS to 3600,3601,3900 (added in 3601); SAPNI to 3200-3299,40000 (instead of just 3200,40000); SAPRFC to 3300-3399 (instead of just 3300 or just 3301, whatever was initially there). Once you have changed the port numbers to suit, press OK to close the Preferences windows, this will save your changes.

 

Additional commands for MacBook M-series

After using brew to install qt5, it is a good idea to copy the suggested commands in the output info and run those. For example I got this info in Terminal:

If you need to have qt@5 first in your PATH, run:

echo 'export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc

For compilers to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export LDFLAGS="-L/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/lib"

export CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/include"

For cmake to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5"

By running these, you avoid errors more easily when e.g. using the 'cmake' command. [Note that if you are using a different shell than zsh, it would be up to you to modify the first export command appropriately].

 

Additional commands for Intel MacBooks

The corresponding extra commands on older Intel MacBooks would be something like the following:

If you need to have qt@5 first in your PATH, run:

echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/qt@5/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc

For compilers to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export LDFLAGS="-L/usr/local/opt/qt@5/lib"

export CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/local/opt/qt@5/include"

For cmake to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/usr/local/opt/qt@5"

entry.title: Unable to deploy application with cdm.json ‚Äì 404 errors in Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello,

Our project involves deploying a Fiori/UI5 application and its associated library to the BTP subaccount DEV_TAL (region: Europe Netherlands ‚Äì eu20), where deployments through BAS and Cloud Foundry normally succeed without errors. We are encountering persistent issues when attempting to migrate deployment of our application through a cdm.json in SAP Build Work Zone.

When deploying from SAP Business Application Studio via Cloud Foundry (mbt build > cf deploy app.mtar), the process works as expected: the application appears in the HTML5 Applications repository, can be managed in the Content Manager, and finally runs correctly when exposed in a site.

The difficulties arise specifically when switching to a CDM-based deployment. Our goal is to automate group and role creation and ensure consistent provisioning of application tiles. For testing, we are deploying a minimal MTA consisting of one application and one library. After setting up the CDM and RT destinations, creating the content provider, and assigning the required roles to both user and site, the tile appears correctly in Build Work Zone.

However, once launched, the application fails to load properly: in the HTML5 Applications repository, the application runs without errors ‚Äì the database not being connected is normal at this point. In Build Work Zone, the tile opens but the application immediately crashes with a flurry of 404 errors. As a result, the application does not boot at all, and the intended library resources remain inaccessible.

We have followed the official tutorial Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone and reproduced its GitHub template, but the outcome remains the same. The issue appears to be tied to the CDM integration and how the application accesses its library and resources once deployed in Build Work Zone.

 

 

 

Environment

  • Subaccount: DEV_TAL
  • Subdomain: dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Subaccount ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Tenant ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Org Name (CF): ARGONandCO_dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Org ID (CF): cafe0aa6-6373-455c-9dd1-f52e2e435364
  • Region: Europe (Netherlands) ‚Äì eu20
  • API Endpoint: https://api.cf.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com
  • Space: dev

 

Reproduction Steps

  1. Run mbt to generate .mtar.
  2. Deploy via cf deploy app.mtar.
  3. Application appears in HTML5 Applications repository in cockpit.
  4. Create a Content Provider using both cdm and rt destinations
  5. Add role to both User and website
  6. Tile appears in BWZ.
  7. Launch the tile.

 

Observed Behavior

  • Tile name appears correctly in BWZ.
  • In the HTML5 Applications repository: application launches with its library
  • In the BWZ: application crashes and shows numerous 404 errors appear in the console.
  • Application does not boot.

 

Expected Behavior

  • Application should launch without errors.
  • Library should be available, and components should load.
  • Groups and roles should be automatically created by CDM.

 

Tests Performed

  • Added and removed the cap-ui prefix to all destinations: no effect, 404 errors persist.
  • Changed _schema-version between "3.1" and "3.2" and the the library path from "/cap-ui.argonuilib-1.0.0" to "/cap-ui.argonuilib", as per the template: no effect, same errors observed.

 

Attachments

  • cdm.json
  • mta.yaml
  • screenshots from BWZ and HTML5 error logs
  • manifests of both application and library
  • index.html of the application

 

References

  • Tutorial followed: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Bu... - SAP Community (GitHub template reproduced).

 

Request

  • Confirm whether additional tenant-specific configuration (e.g. contentProvider mapping) is required.
  • Clarify which files are critical in CDM deployment that could block the process (mta.yaml, cdm.json, manifest.json, xs-app.json, ui5.yaml‚Ä¶).
  • Clarify the pathing necessary to and from the library from the application (e.g. resourceRoots in manifest.json, data-sap-ui-resourceroots in index.html, etc.).
  • Clarify where and when the sap.cloud.service should be attached to destinations

entry.title: Re: MIRO transaction PO details is not showing
entry.content:
Hi,
If you're not seeing PO details in the MIRO transaction screen in SAP, here are a few common causes and troubleshooting steps you can try:

Please find the possible reasons and fixes

Missing Goods Receipt (GR):
If the PO is for materials, ensure the GR has been posted. Use transaction MB51 or ME2N to verify GR status.

Service PO without Entry Sheet:
For service POs, you must create a Service Entry Sheet using ML81N before MIRO. Without it, the PO details won't appear.

Incorrect Item Category or Account Assignment:
If the PO uses item category "F" (for services) or has account assignment, ensure all required fields are correctly filled and posted.

User-Specific Authorization Issues:
Sometimes, PO details show for one user but not another. This could be due to missing roles or authorization objects. Compare user roles and authorizations

Either as the link (above) says using the name `BGPF` or literally `DEFAULT`, depending on the system you're on I'd say.

Our on-prem sandbox has both configured ...

Maybe that helps, though, I will see what other opinions are here. üôÇ

BR, Marco

entry.title: Re: Correct config to release returned stock from Blocked...
entry.content:
Hello @SAPSupport 

The system is blocking the manual moving from Blocked to Unrestricted because the stock is still flagged for returns inspection. In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, customer return inspections are managed within the warehouse process, which is why a traditional QM lot would appear in QA32. Instead, record and complete the inspection via Enter Inspection Results from Warehouse. SAP Help Portal-Enter Inspection Results - From Warehouse

To release stock, open Enter Inspection Results from Warehouse (MSR_INSPWH) for the return, record results, set Logistical Follow-Up Activity to 0011 (Transfer to Free Stock), then Save and Confirm. This post stocks to Unrestricted and clears the inspection reference. Using 0031 (No further activities) won't create a posting change and leaves the stock blocked under inspection.  SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

  • What you should do?
  • App: Enter Inspection Results ‚Äì From Warehouse (MSR_INSPWH). This is the warehouse inspection app you need for customer returns

Process Inspection Lots ‚Äî App ID: (launchpad). Note that the official name uses the plural form.

Follow-up activity: 0011 ‚Äì Transfer to Free Available Stock. SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: flow control between exception sub process and main flow: SAP CPI-IS
entry.content: The pictures are not clear Sugata. Does your main flow have an exception handler? Also iFlow exception process does not mimic the traditional way of try/catch blocks. Ending the exception block with "End Message" and setting the flow status to true before that, may be nullifying it. Needs a detailed look into it!

entry.title: How to automatically create an Email Interaction via Workflow Rule in SAP Sales Cloud (C4C)?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently working on a requirement in SAP Sales Cloud (C4C) related to Ticket Interactions, and I would appreciate your help to clarify the correct configuration steps.

 

Business scenario

When a new ticket is created in C4C, I need an automatic email to be sent to the customer (either Individual Customer or Account contact) depending on the value in the "Incident Category ID" field and "Ticket Type" field

Additionally, this email interaction should appear under the Interactions tab of the ticket ‚Äî the same way as manually sent or received emails are displayed.

What I‚Äôve done so far

  1. I created a Workflow Rule for the Ticket  Business Object (Timing = On create only; Rule Type=E-mail)

  2. The rule is triggered On Create when Incident Category ID= ‚ÄúX‚Äù and Ticket Type = "X"

  3. As an action, I selected E-mail and uploaded an HTML file via the Template File field.

  4. Recipient Determination: Contact of Account or Individual Account for Ticket

However:

  • The workflow sends no email (or I can‚Äôt confirm if it does).

  • No Interaction record appears in the Interactions tab of the ticket.

Thanks a lot in advance for any guidance or documentation links ‚Äî I‚Äôve already checked the SAP Help Portal and Community posts about workflow rules and ticket interactions, but I couldn‚Äôt find an end-to-end example of this scenario.

I‚Äôd also appreciate any insights on whether there are additional configuration steps related to the Email Activity that I might be missing.

Best regards,

entry.title: Integration Advisor: Early UN/EDIFACT Versions with Syntax Version 2 Now Available
entry.content:
Today, I would like to share an update regarding the B2B Library versions included in our Integration Advisor (of SAP Integration Suite) offering. Recently, we added three additional UN/EDIFACT versions from the early 1990s. 

Early Versions of the UN/EDIFACT standard

We have added three additional early versions: 90.2 S2, 91.1 S2 and 91.2 S2 ‚Äì bringing the total number of supported UN/EDIFACT versions to 63.

To the best of our knowledge, even older versions (particularly 90.1 S1) are not in productive use. However, please contact us if you require this S1 version, and we will evaluate whether it can be added.

Interoperability of Syntax Version 2 (S2) and Syntax Version 3 (S3)

UN/EDIFACT syntax versions (defined by ISO 9735) are sets of rules specifying the structure of EDIFACT messages. To date, four syntax versions have been published by the UN/ECE organization: S1, S2, S3, and S4.  

These syntax versions are, in a way, orthogonal to the UN/EDIFACT versions / releases (such as 91.2 or D.01B). However, it is common practice to display UN/EDIFACT versions alongside the syntax version that was in use at the time the UN/EDIFACT version was published (e.g., 91.2 S2 or D.01B S3).

Accordingly, Integration Advisor displays all previously published UN/EDIFACT versions with the suffix S3, while the recently added versions are shown with the suffix S2.

It is important to note that syntax versions 2 and 3 are almost identical, differing only in the allowed code pages (UNOA-UNOB for S2 versus UNOA-UNOF for S3) defined in data element UNB > S001 > 0001.

This is why you can also use later UN/EDIFACT versions with syntax version 2 or use earlier UN/EDIFACT versions with syntax version 3.  

Code Values for syntax-related Data Elements  

The UN/EDIFACT standard includes certain core data elements, typically named 00**, which are used in service segments such as UNB, UNG, UNH, UNT, or UNZ. Originally, the UN/ECE organization did not provide code values for some of these core data elements and only began doing so in the mid-1990s.

Integration Advisor strives to publish B2B Library definitions as provided by the standardization organizations. As a result, the recently added UN/EDIFACT versions do not include code values for data elements 0002, 0052, or 0054.

Handling of Code Values associated with UN/CEFACT codelists

Since 1991, UN/ECE has recommended using UN/CEFACT codelists for certain UN/EDIFACT data elements. The table below lists the affected data elements along with their assigned UN/CEFACT codelists: 

Data ElementDescriptionUN/EDIFACT CodelistUN/CEFACT Codelist
4053Delivery or transport terms4053Rec 5
4277Payment terms4277Rec 17
4405Transport status4405Rec 24
6411Measurement units6411Rec 20 
7065Package types7065Rec 21
8023Freight and charges identification8023Rec 23
8067Transport modes8067Rec 19
8179Transport means8179Rec 28

Accordingly, Integration Advisor provides links from these data elements to the latest version of the listed UN/CEFACT recommendations. This applies to all versions of UN/EDIFACT starting from 91.1 S2. (Please note that the UN/EDIFACT standard did not maintain any code values for these data elements in the earlier version 90.2 S2.)

For versions 91.1 S2 and 91.2 S2, we also provide UN/EDIFACT codelists containing the code values as they were originally published by the UN/EDIFACT standard. In your Message Implementation Guideline (MIG), you have the option to use either the original UN/EDIFACT code values or the current UN/CEFACT code values.  

Consumption in Cloud Integration  

Since earlier this year, the Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite has supported all UN/EDIFACT syntax versions (S1 through S4). This means you can process UN/EDIFACT payloads in all the EDI flow steps, such as EDI Splitter, EDI Extractor, EDI-To-XML Converter, and XML-To-EDI Converter, based on all these syntax versions. 

Note: You need to use the latest version of these EDI flow steps. In your Integration Flow, simply add the EDI flow steps from the palette to ensure you are using the newest version.

For the older UN/EDIFACT versions, there is one additional detail to note: 

  • Since release D.93A S3 in 1993, UN/EDIFACT has used the value D for field UNH > S009 > 0052. As a result, the EDI flow steps expect an XSD file name like UN-EDIFACT_ORDERS_D96A.xsd.
  • However, for releases prior to D.93A S3, other values (such as 1 or 2) were used for field UNH > S009 > 0052. In these cases, the EDI flow steps expect an XSD file name like UN-EDIFACT_ORDERS_2912.xsd.

Integration Advisor has recently added a new field Configure EDIFACT Message Version to tab Runtime Context (of your MIG) where this value can be maintained - see the screenshot below.   

When you create a new Message Implementation Guideline (MIG), Integration Advisor automatically selects an appropriate default value based on the following rules: 

  • Use D as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions starting with D (from D.93A onwards) 
  • Use 1 as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions not starting with D and having a minor version of 1 (applies to versions 91.1 S2 and 92.1 S3) 
  • Use 2 as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions not starting with D and having a minor version of 2 (applies to versions 90.2 S2, 91.2 S2, and 93.2 S3) 

In most cases, the default value should meet your requirements. If not, you can easily redefine this value in your MIG.

Conclusion

With this latest update, Integration Advisor has added three early UN/EDIFACT versions associated with Syntax Version 2. This enables you to build your Message Implementation Guidelines (MIGs) and Mapping Guidelines (MAGs) based on these S2 versions.

Further reading

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/overview-of-b2b-standards 

https://blogs.sap.com/2021/09/28/integration-advisor-overview-of-components-for-building-b2b-integra...
https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/13/integration-content-advisor-create-a-customized-interface-using-mig...

entry.title: Re: KSS2-assign splitting structure ERRORÔºö Client 100 has status 'not modifiable' Message no. TK4
entry.content: You‚Äôll usually see that ‚ÄúClient 100 has status ‚Äònot modifiable‚Äô (TK430)‚Äù message when trying to make config-level changes in a client set as Production or No Changes allowed. If you can‚Äôt adjust SCC4, one workaround is to perform the assignment in a customizing client, then transport the change into Client 100. Alternatively, check if you can use SM30 ‚Üí V_TKA09 (depending on authorizations) to adjust splitting structure assignments indirectly. Also make sure you‚Äôre not in a cross-client table when doing it ‚Äî that‚Äôs often why the modifiability restriction triggers.

entry.title: Re: Gathering both Machine and labor time from APO (PA3)
entry.content:
Good day @petrocsek 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, it is standard that only the scheduling relevant capacity is transferred from ERP work center when integrating APO. Labour time is not transferred automatically. However, you consider the following options:

  • First is to use custom enhancement to capture and store labour time during your CIF transfer.
  • Second option is to model dual resources (machine and Labour) and activate secondary resource transfer in CIF customising.

Alternatively, potential simpler way is for you to maintain labour vs. Machine time reporting directly in ERP through the BW extractors.

Have you had a look at the references for more details.

 How Are the Details of the Order Mapped in SAP APO and SAP R/3?

Integration of Resources

https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-q-a/pooled-capacity-in-apo/qaq-p/9901760

 Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE‚Ä¶ and what it is not !
entry.content:
Hello Mel,

Your existing BW 7.5 PCE deployment in US20 can stay where it is, regardless where the public cloud components of BDC are deployed. That's because there's no co-location requirement for the private and public component services.

Your SAP sales team can help you restructure your existing contract to fit the BW landscape under the BDC commercial umbrella and with that, you'd have access to the Data Product Generator. In addition,  you can plan for a reduction of the BW landscape (aka scale-down) , free up the BW-dedicated capacity units, and then use them for the public cloud component services.

I hope this helps,
Karsten

entry.title: Value Help as dropdown, not F4 in Custom Fields - Code List
entry.content:
Hello, 

the topic is about implementing a Custom Field via KeyUser Extensions. 

I was wondering is there anyway to change the standard behavior of displaying the Value Help for the Custom Field based on Code List. The default scenario is the Value Help opens up:

My question is - can it be changed to the dropdown list (Like in the Status field in screenshot)? In the documentation I see that it should be automatically be done as Dropdown when the data set is small - I have only 7 values. But it appears as a F4 Value Help. 

Of course I can create a CDS based Code List - and then manually set the @ObjectModel.resultSet.sizeCategory: #XS. But in the regular Code List you cannot edit ABAP files. And for e.g. for Custom Fields with 3-4 values I don't want to have to create an additional table, text table for translations, value help CDS, and then the Custom Fields. 

Any solutions to that?

entry.title: Re: Cracking the ‚Äú!‚Äù Mystery in SAP on Sybase ASE: Why isql Rejects Your Password
entry.content:
You're still not out of the woods.

In unix/linux shells (eg, bash, ksh) , if the password contains a dollar sign ($) and is either a) not wrapped in quotes or b) is wrapped in double quotes then the $ is treated by the shell as an indicator of a (shell) variable reference.

Consider:

$ echo 123$x456
123

$ echo "123$x456"
123

$ echo '123$x456'
123$x456

$ echo 123$456
12356

$ echo "123$456"
12356

$ echo '123$456'
123$456

In the 1st and 2nd cases (no quotes, double quotes) the shell thinks $x456 is a variable reference and  since (in this case) there is no variable named x456 the shell replaces $x456 with an empty string (ie, nothing) so the echo only sees 123.

In the 3rd case (single quotes) the shell makes no attempt to interpret the contents (within the single quotes) so the $ is treated as a literal character and the echo sees the entire string.

In the 4th and 5th cases (no quotes, double quotes) the $4 is treated by the shell as a reference to the 4th input parameter to the script; assuming there is no 4th input parameter the shell replaces $4 with an empty string (ie, nothing) so the echo sees 12356.

In the 6th case (single quotes) the shell makes no attempt to interpret the contents (within the single quotes) so the $ is treated as a literal character and the echo sees the entire string 123$456.

------------------

Net result:

  • several of the characters listed as Valid special character have special meaning to unix/linux shells; single quotes should disable the (unix/linux) shell's attempts to interpret said characters
  • only one set of (single) quotes is necessary so ...
  • in the isql/password example it should be sufficient to use -P 'a!terpwd123'
  • NOTE: for an embedded single quote (also a Valid special character !!) switching to double quotes would be one solution, eg, "sample'string", 'sample'"'"'string' - in the 2nd case the middle '"'"' is a single quote (match leading single quote) plus "  '  " (wrap single quote in double quote) plus single quote (match trailing single quote)

entry.title: Unable Time Recording Changes on SAP Public Cloud- Professional Services
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are currently working on a SAP Public Cloud ‚Äì Professional Services greenfield implementation. The customer does not have payroll integration and intends to use SAP data to perform payroll in another system.

The configuration we would like to implement is to restrict the ability to adjust timesheets for previous payroll weeks. Specifically, we want to prevent modifications in the ‚ÄúManage My Timesheets‚Äù app for the two weeks prior to the current working week.

In exploring the configuration option ‚ÄúMaintain Data Entry Profile (S/4HANA: SCIUSS: 102509)‚Äù, we have found the ‚ÄúNo changes after approval‚Äù setting but have not identified additional scope items to handle this specific requirement.

Do you have any insights on the feasibility of this? Our intent is not to block entire weeks, but only the past two weeks relative to the current working period.

Thank you in advance for your guidance.
Melis

entry.title: Duplicity in article assignment
entry.content:
Duplicate Item Assignment

In our company, we have prescriptive courses that must be completed within a certain timeframe. In this case, there are two items with the same assignment profile. For the past few days, duplicate assignments of the same course have been recorded for the same user (22,000 users). It's worth noting that these users had already passed the course; however, the system reassigned them and they've now taken the same course twice. Some users report that they've already taken it and appear to have been reassigned. Furthermore, the completion dates have changed, and when I try to change the course details, I'm not getting the desired result.

I hope you can help me.
Thank you very much.
Luis.

entry.title: Navigating SAP Security and Cloud Compliance Topics
entry.content:
Navigating SAP Security and Cloud Compliance Topics

SAP offers customers several options to find resources and information on security and cloud compliance topics within our solution suite. This blog will walk you through some of the options, including:

  • the SAP Trust Center,
  • SAP for Me,
  • the My Trust Center, and also
  • how to navigate within the SAP Community

Our aim is to help our customers find the information they need with ease.

SAP Trust Center (Public Facing)

The SAP Trust Center helps customers understand the framework behind Security, Privacy, and Compliance with SAP. From here customers can also learn how to report security issues or discover SAP‚Äôs security products and services, access agreements, have visibility into cloud availability, and more.

On the compliance side, the SAP Trust Center highlights SAP‚Äôs routine audits and certification documentation including: ISO/IEC, SOC, bridge letters, and industry-specific standards like TISAX (Trusted Information Security Assessment Exchange). For customers and stakeholders who want to know how SAP demonstrates security, trust, and transparency practices, we invite you to visit the SAP Trust Center.

SAP for Me - (SAP valid S-user ID)

SAP for Me is designed to provide SAP customers on-demand access to cloud compliance documents such as certifications, attestations, and SOC reports. Eligible users with a customer account can employ filters, like Offering Type, Compliance Entity, Assessment Period or Region/Country to identify required resources. As part of the Portfolio and Products section of SAP for Me, this tool serves as the go-to destination for downloading compliance documents quickly and securely for authorized users.

Beyond compliance, SAP for Me also acts as a digital companion, consolidating alerts, metrics, and delivering insights about your SAP product portfolio in one central place. SAP for Me is a time saver in today‚Äôs fast paced environment.

My Trust Center (SAP valid S-user ID)

Within the SAP Trust Center, the My Trust Center amplifies the experience for SAP customers and partners by offering authenticated access to customer-facing resources and enablement materials. The My Trust Center offers customers the ability to subscribe to specific resources, so subscribers are notified by e-mail whenever relevant content is updated. This feature saves you from having to check back for new versions.

Customers can access information about SAP‚Äôs subprocessors and data fact sheets, as well as explore regulatory requirements across different regions. It also includes policies, frameworks, and support schedules that help you align your governance frameworks with SAP‚Äôs standards. These resources are intended to support customers with regulatory obligations within their organization.

SAP Community (Public Facing)

Of course, compliance is not just about official documents, it is also about the shared knowledge and experiences that help customers put best practices into action. The SAP Community has 1.4 million members and it is one of the best places for collaboration across products, industries, and regions. The SAP Community knowledge base serves as a growing library of documents and resources that offer insights, related links, and contributions from SAP experts and customers.

Alongside the SAP Community knowledge base, users can access the Security and Compliance interest group to catch up with blogs and discussion posts that offer real-world perspectives on cyber resilience, AI, regulatory changes, and more. The SAP Community gives users the ability to search for answers, leave comments or ask experts questions, and even contribute thoughts or best practices. Overall, the SAP Community is a great place to not only find information but also learn from others who have experienced similar challenges and successes as your own.

SAP User Groups (Public Facing)

Another valuable channel for customers and users to expand their knowledge and exchange experiences is through SAP User Groups. These independent not-for-profit groups offer opportunities for networking, collaboration, and learning among peers. On a global scale, user groups host webcasts, local events, and special interest sessions that encourage dialogue and hands-on learning. Whether engaging at a regional level or connecting across international networks, SAP User Groups allow customers direct access to practical experiences and shared expertise that complement SAP‚Äôs own platforms and resources.

Conclusion

Whether a customer is searching for official certifications, a transparent view of SAP‚Äôs best practices, tailored compliance reports, or community driven knowledge, SAP provides accessible tools to support every step of your engagement journey.

Bookmark the pages below and share them with your team to stay informed.  

Link Repository

Platform

Link

SAP for Me

https://me.sap.com/

Access and Authorizations

https://support.sap.com/content/s4m/help/access/user-admin-concept.html

SAP Trust Center

https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center.html

My Trust Center

https://support.sap.com/en/my-support/trust-center.html

SAP Community

https://community.sap.com/

SAP Community Security and Compliance Interest Group

https://community.sap.com/t5/security-and-compliance/gh-p/security-compliance

SAP User Groups

https://www.sap.com/about/user-groups.html

entry.title: RAP Event: consume SAP standard event and trigger custom RAP event
entry.content:
1. Introduction

Event-driven architecture (EDA) is an integrated model that detects critical business "events" and responds to them in real time. As modern businesses seek real-time operations and flexible, responsive systems, EDA has become an essential technology.
Many standard RAP events are provided for the implementation of the event-driven architecture in SAP S/4HANA, but the standard event payload may not meet business requirements and require customization. In particular, there is a use case where SAP standard events are extended with Derived Events for the purpose of filtering by event data and payload completion of standard events.
Derived Event is available in S/4HANA Cloud, private edition & S/4HANA 2023 / S/4HANA Cloud, public edition Introduced in the 2308 release, this feature allows you to define new events with custom payloads based on existing SAP standard events. This allows you to reuse standard event implementations while creating events with additional fields and filtering criteria that you need for your business.
SAP Community Blog: Derived Events- How to Trigger Custom Event from an SAP Standard Event
On the other hand, a Derived Event requires that the SAP Standard object to be extended meets the following conditions:

  • The business object containing the referring event must be extensible.
  • The referenced event must be published on the C0 and C1 released RAP BO interfaces
  • The CDS view entity used as the data source for the Derived Event payload must have been released in C1

Therefore, some objects do not support extensibility with Derived Events in SAP Standard RAP BO. In this case, there may be cases where the requirements that should be solved by Derived Events cannot be realized.
So, in this blog, we will introduce a workaround approach that enables payload expansion with custom RAP BO for SAP standard events that cannot be extended with Derived Events.

 

2. Workaround Solutions

If Derived Events are not available, a workaround approach that combines Local Event Consumption with custom RAP events can be an effective approach. This approach involves consuming SAP standard events locally (custom ABAP classes) and using them as triggers to raise custom RAP events. By setting the payload of a custom event to meet your business requirements, you can use event filters.

 

3. Implementation Sample

In this blog, we will use a non-extensible r_purchaseordertp as the target object to extend the event payload for data changes in a PO document. SAP standard events have a payload of only the purchase order document number, whereas custom events have a purchase order document number and purchase order type as the payload. For more information on Event Binding and channel configuration with Event Mesh, please visit the SAP Community Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-create-rap-business-events-in-sap-s-4hana-on-premise-2022/ba-p/13553312 . Please note that the RAP BO in the implementation sample in this blog does not implement CRUD or save processing other than events.

 

(1) Local Consumer (Custom ABAP Class for Local Event Consumption)

Global class: zcl_event_consump

In the Global class, the definition FOR EVENTS OF r_purchaseordertp sets the standard events to be consumed.

CLASS zcl_event_consump DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  ABSTRACT
  FINAL
  FOR EVENTS OF r_purchaseordertp.

  PUBLIC SECTION.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.



CLASS zcl_event_consump IMPLEMENTATION.
ENDCLASS.

 

Local class: zcl_event_consump

The Local class performs additional data retrieval based on the data from the standard event payload consumed to trigger a custom RAP event.
It is important to note that triggering events is only possible in the RAP framework with a Save Sequence, so you must explicitly change it to Save Sequence by cl_abap_tx=>save( ).

*"* use this source file for the definition and implementation of
*"* local helper classes, interface definitions and type
*"* declarations
CLASS lcl_event_consump DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_event_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS:
      consume_changed FOR ENTITY EVENT changed_instances FOR purchaseorder~changed.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_event_consump IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD consume_changed.
    cl_abap_tx=>save(  ).

    DATA lv_potype TYPE mm_purchaseordertype.

    CHECK changed_instances IS NOT INITIAL.

    LOOP AT changed_instances INTO DATA(changed_instance).

      SELECT SINGLE purchaseordertype
      FROM c_purchaseordertp
      INTO _potype
      WHERE purchaseorder = @changed_instance-purchaseorder.

      DATA(et_events) = VALUE zbp_i_purchseorder_test=>tt_events(
        (
        purchaseorder = changed_instance-purchaseorder
        purchaseordertype = lv_potype
        )
      ).

      zbp_i_purchseorder_event=>raise_po_changed_event( it_events = et_events ).

    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

 

(2) Custom RAP BO (Custom Event)

CDS View: ZI_purchseorder_event

In the CDS View, I define only the purchase order.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Consume purchase order event'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
  serviceQuality: #X,
  sizeCategory: #S,
  dataClass: #MIXED
}
define root view entity ZI_purchseorder_event as select from I_PurchaseOrder
{
  key PurchaseOrder
}
 
Behavior Definition: ZI_purchseorder_event

Custom RAP BO for event triggers does not define the create/update/delete function.

managed with unmanaged save implementation in class zbp_i_purchseorder_event unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for ZI_purchseorder_event //alias <alias_name>
//persistent table ekko
lock master
authorization master ( instance )
//etag master <field_name>
{
  //  create;
  //  update;
  //  delete;
  event purchaseorder_changed parameter ZAB_PO_changed_event;

  field ( readonly ) PurchaseOrder;
}
Behavior Implementation (Global class) : zbp_i_purchseorder_event

In the Global class, I define a method for triggering events.

CLASS zbp_i_purchseorder_event DEFINITION PUBLIC ABSTRACT FINAL FOR BEHAVIOR OF zi_purchseorder_event.

  TYPES tt_events TYPE TABLE FOR EVENT zi_purchseorder_event~purchaseorder_changed.

  PUBLIC SECTION.
        CLASS-METHODS raise_po_changed_event
            IMPORTING it_events TYPE tt_events.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS zbp_i_purchseorder_event IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD raise_po_changed_event.
  lcl_event_handler=>on_po_changed_event( it_events ).
endmethod.
ENDCLASS.
 
Behavior Implementation (Local class) : lhc_zi_purchseorder_event

The Local class does not implement save processing, etc., but only implements methods for triggering events.

CLASS lhc_zi_purchseorder_event DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zi_purchseorder_event RESULT result.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_zi_purchseorder_event IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lsc_zi_purchseorder_event DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_saver.
  PROTECTED SECTION.

    METHODS save_modified REDEFINITION.

    METHODS cleanup_finalize REDEFINITION.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lsc_zi_purchseorder_event IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD save_modified.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD cleanup_finalize.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_event_handler DEFINITION FRIENDS zbp_i_purchseorder_event.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS on_po_changed_event IMPORTING it_events TYPE zbp_i_purchseorder_event=>tt_events.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_event_handler IMPLEMENTATION.
   METHOD on_po_changed_event.

    RAISE ENTITY EVENT ZI_purchseorder_event~purchaseorder_changed FROM it_events.

   ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
 
Abstract Entity: ZAB_PO_changed_event

Abstract entity adds a purchase order document type. This results in the payload of the custom RAP event being the purchase order document number and the purchase order document type.

@EndUserText.label: 'Abastract entity for po changed event'
define abstract entity ZAB_PO_changed_event
  //  with parameters parameter_name : parameter_type
{
  PurchaseOrderType : mm_purchaseordertype;
}

 

4. Implementation Results

Modify and save an existing purchase order document from the Manage Purchase Orders (F0842A) app.

 

You can receive custom events triggered from S/4HANA in SAP Event Mesh.

 

5. Summary

When it is not possible to scale with Derived Events in implementing an event-driven architecture, a workaround approach that combines Local Event Consumption with custom RAP events is an effective approach.
This approach enables custom payloads and filtering capabilities based on business requirements, providing event consumers with the data they need to optimize cross-system integration.

 

References

SAP LearningÔºöExplaining Event-Driven Architecture
SAP Help: Event-driven Architecture
SAP Community Blog: RAP Business Events with Advanced Event Mesh [2]: Creating custom business events
SAP Community Blog: RAP Business Events with Advanced Event Mesh [5]: Consuming a local business event

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud - Create a custom Data Product based on a replication Flow
entry.content:
Hello,
I found with the trial that the "lienage of a Data product" is not visible (for standard and for custom data product).
I can see the impact of a data product if I look the lineage of a SAC Story.

But I can not see the lineage of a data product (namely which CDS views are the source for the data product).

The only way is to have a "BDC privilege" and look in the BDC catalog the name of the API (only for the standard products).

Not be able to see visually what is the source, what is behind a data product is a big problem in proposal to customers for the catalog.
I can understand that for the Standard, the hidden spaces that compose the FOS are SAP managed and basically you can not see what happens behind, but for a custom DP it seems strange to me.


Is that a limitation of the BDC trial ? Will this be addressed with the next "data product studio"?

entry.title: Navigating SAP Security and Cloud Compliance Topics
entry.content:
Navigating SAP Security and Cloud Compliance Topics

SAP offers customers several options to find resources and information on security and cloud compliance topics within our solution suite. This blog will walk you through some of the options, including:

  • the SAP Trust Center,
  • SAP for Me,
  • the My Trust Center, and also
  • how to navigate within the SAP Community

Our aim is to help our customers find the information they need with ease.

SAP Trust Center (Public Facing)

The SAP Trust Center helps customers understand the framework behind Security, Privacy, and Compliance with SAP. From here customers can also learn how to report security issues or discover SAP‚Äôs security products and services, access agreements, have visibility into cloud availability, and more.

On the compliance side, the SAP Trust Center highlights SAP‚Äôs routine audits and certification documentation including: ISO/IEC, SOC, bridge letters, and industry-specific standards like TISAX (Trusted Information Security Assessment Exchange). For customers and stakeholders who want to know how SAP demonstrates security, trust, and transparency practices, we invite you to visit the SAP Trust Center.

SAP for Me - (SAP valid S-user ID)

SAP for Me is designed to provide SAP customers on-demand access to cloud compliance documents such as certifications, attestations, and SOC reports. Eligible users with a customer account can employ filters, like Offering Type, Compliance Entity, Assessment Period or Region/Country to identify required resources. As part of the Portfolio and Products section of SAP for Me, this tool serves as the go-to destination for downloading compliance documents quickly and securely for authorized users.

Beyond compliance, SAP for Me also acts as a digital companion, consolidating alerts, metrics, and delivering insights about your SAP product portfolio in one central place. SAP for Me is a time saver in today‚Äôs fast paced environment.

My Trust Center (SAP valid S-user ID)

Within the SAP Trust Center, the My Trust Center amplifies the experience for SAP customers and partners by offering authenticated access to customer-facing resources and enablement materials. The My Trust Center offers customers the ability to subscribe to specific resources, so subscribers are notified by e-mail whenever relevant content is updated. This feature saves you from having to check back for new versions.

Customers can access information about SAP‚Äôs subprocessors and data fact sheets, as well as explore regulatory requirements across different regions. It also includes policies, frameworks, and support schedules that help you align your governance frameworks with SAP‚Äôs standards. These resources are intended to support customers with regulatory obligations within their organization.

SAP Community (Public Facing)

Of course, compliance is not just about official documents, it is also about the shared knowledge and experiences that help customers put best practices into action. The SAP Community has 1.4 million members and it is one of the best places for collaboration across products, industries, and regions. The SAP Community knowledge base serves as a growing library of documents and resources that offer insights, related links, and contributions from SAP experts and customers.

Alongside the SAP Community knowledge base, users can access the Security and Compliance interest group to catch up with blogs and discussion posts that offer real-world perspectives on cyber resilience, AI, regulatory changes, and more. The SAP Community gives users the ability to search for answers, leave comments or ask experts questions, and even contribute thoughts or best practices. Overall, the SAP Community is a great place to not only find information but also learn from others who have experienced similar challenges and successes as your own.

SAP User Groups (Public Facing)

Another valuable channel for customers and users to expand their knowledge and exchange experiences is through SAP User Groups. These independent not-for-profit groups offer opportunities for networking, collaboration, and learning among peers. On a global scale, user groups host webcasts, local events, and special interest sessions that encourage dialogue and hands-on learning. Whether engaging at a regional level or connecting across international networks, SAP User Groups allow customers direct access to practical experiences and shared expertise that complement SAP‚Äôs own platforms and resources.

 

Conclusion

Whether a customer is searching for official certifications, a transparent view of SAP‚Äôs best practices, tailored compliance reports, or community driven knowledge, SAP provides accessible tools to support every step of your engagement journey.

Bookmark the pages below and share them with your team to stay informed.  

Link Repository

Platform

Link

SAP for Me

https://me.sap.com/

Access and Authorizations

https://support.sap.com/content/s4m/help/access/user-admin-concept.html

SAP Trust Center

https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center.html

My Trust Center

https://support.sap.com/en/my-support/trust-center.html

SAP Community

https://community.sap.com/

SAP Community Security and Compliance Interest Group

https://community.sap.com/t5/security-and-compliance/gh-p/security-compliance

SAP User Groups

https://www.sap.com/about/user-groups.html

entry.title: Re: SAP CPI to Microsoft SharePoint Adapter Integration
entry.content:
Alex,

these instructions seem to be not correct and are incomplete - it doesn't work, many users seem to get the same error as I: Invalid Audience.

- Is the scope really https://graph.microsoft.com/.default, and not https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/.default? 

- Is it correct to leave the field 'Audience' blank in the oauth2 security material? 

- Is the token URL correct as follows?: https://login.microsoftonline.com/xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx/oauth2/v2.0/token?  Or are you using token endpoint v1?    

By the way, I don't think the headers have to be set in the IFlow. That's implicitly done in the token request, and not required for the POST to the server.

entry.title: Re: Building Sustainable Supply Chains: From Design to Reuse
entry.content:
Key Takeaways: Building Sustainable Supply Chains.
Sustainability is essential: It‚Äôs no longer just a compliance requirement but a way to gain a competitive edge.

Circular supply chains are key: Focus on reducing environmental impact at every stage‚Äîfrom design to reuse.

Smart design choices can significantly reduce a product's environmental footprint.

Planning with sustainability: Tools like SAP IBP help integrate sustainability into decision-making, from carbon footprint optimization to compliance.

Procurement as a driver: Sustainable sourcing is crucial for reducing environmental impact, supported by SAP tools like Ariba and Sustainability Data Exchange.

Manufacturing & logistics: Focus on minimizing emissions, waste, and energy use at every step of production and transportation.

Circular practices: Reuse and remanufacturing help reduce waste, cut costs, and create new business opportunities.

entry.title: Re: How to run "local" tRFC via bgRFC? (local: with no destination or 'NONE')
entry.content:
I don't know if 'NONE' is to be considered outbound or inbound, because there's no queue implied.

tRFC = "once only in any order (transactional)"

I don't see any difference with the inbound scenario:

" Create the inbound destination (queue) 'ZZZINBQ' in SBGRFCCONF
DATA(lo_destination_rfc) = cl_bgrfc_destination_inbound=>create( 'ZZZINBQ' ).
DATA(lo_trfc_unit) = lo_destination_rfc->create_trfc_unit( ).
CALL FUNCTION 'Z_RFC'
     IN BACKGROUND UNIT lo_trfc_unit
     EXPORTING iv_vbeln = iv_vbeln.

 There is this "bgRFC type t" example in the SAP Library, there's no example with outbound:

DATA: my_destination TYPE REF TO if_bgrfc_destination_inbound,
      my_unit        TYPE REF TO if_trfc_unit_inbound,
      lock_id        TYPE bgrfc_lock_id,
      dest_name      TYPE bgrfc_dest_name_inbound.

dest_name = 'MY_DEST'.
my_destination = cl_bgrfc_destination_inbound=>create( dest_name ).
my_unit = my_destination->create_trfc_unit( ). 
CALL FUNCTION 'rfc_function_1' IN BACKGROUND UNIT my_unit. 
CALL FUNCTION 'rfc_function_2' IN BACKGROUND UNIT my_unit.
lock_id = my_unit->delay( 300 ).
COMMIT WORK.

So, still the BIG question: what means outbound and inbound in bgRFC type t, how to program them, together, separately, ...?

entry.title: Re: Duplicity in article assignment
entry.content: Hey, I would first look at the assignment profile. Confirm that the learner's assignments indicate that the item was assigned by the AP. if so, has there been ANY changes to the AP? Almost sounds like it was deactivated and reactivated. An item in an assignment profile will not recognize prior completions. A curriculum would be the only way to recognize prior completions for this scenario. Heather
